creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
A site node can be set to invisible by adding the 'visible="false"' attribute to
the desired node in the sitetree.

Example: in the sitetree below the node with the id "new_doctype" would not be
displayed by sitetree2nav.xsl. Unfortunately its use is limited since this works
both in the Authorizing View and in the Site View as well as the Live view. No
doubt sitetree2nav.xsl could be adjusted to overcome this.


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<site xmlns="http://apache.org/cocoon/lenya/sitetree/1.0"
xmlns:i18n="http://apache.org/cocoon/i18n/2.1"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" i18n:attr="label"
label="Live" xsi:schemaLocation="http://apache.org/cocoon/lenya/sitetree/1.0   
  ../../../../resources/entities/sitetree.xsd">
    
  <node id="index">
    <label xml:lang="en">Home</label>
  </node>
  
<node id="tutorial" >
<label xml:lang="en">Tutorial</label>
<node id="new_doctype" visible="false" >
<label xml:lang="en">Create new doctype</label>
</node>
</node>
</site>
